title: Renée Zellweger cuts a casual figure in a relaxed white top as she arrives at BBC Radio 2
text:
She's been tirelessly promoting her role as the late Hollywood icon Judy Garland.

But Renée Zellweger opted for a low-key ensemble as she arrived at the BBC Radio 2 Studios in London on Thursday.

The American actress, 50, cut a casual figure in a simple white top and combat trousers as she headed to an interview with Nicki Chapman on the Breakfast Show about the biopic.

Relaxed: Renée Zellweger, 50, opted for a relaxed white top and combat trousers as she arrived at BBC Radio 2 to promote her acclaimed role in Judy

Renée opted for a completely low-key look as she headed into the radio studio for her interview, highlighted her slender figure in a tight white top.

The Bridget Jones star teamed the top with muted green combat trousers and a brown lace-up boots.

Renée finished her off-duty ensemble in an orange baseball cap as she wore barely a scrap of makeup for the interview.

As she arrived at the studio, Renée made a brief stop to sign autographs for delighted fans, before chatting to Nicki about her role in the Judy biopic.

Out and about: The actress was relaxed in the simple white top and muted green trousers, and hid her blonde tresses under an orange baseball cap

Renée has been promoting her role in Judy amid its release on Wednesday 2nd October.

In Judy, Renee recreates the last year of Garland's life as she prepared for a series of shows in London in early 1969.

Dogged by ill health, money worries and addiction to pills, the appearances were mostly disastrous.

'It’s hard to fully appreciate the context of the circumstances that she was grappling with at the time,' Renee recently said in an interview with USA Today.

'And when you see what she was able to achieve in spite of the challenges she faced, then you can really see how extraordinary she was,' she added. 'It sort of sets her apart, in my opinion.'

Happy: As she arrived for the interview on the breakfast show, Renée happily stopped to sign autographs for fans

Uncanny: Renee (left) is getting rave reviews and Oscar buzz for her portrayal of Judy Garland (right) in the film, based on Peter Quilter’s musical play End Of The Rainbow

In March 1969, Garland married her fifth husband Mickey Deans, played in the movie by Finn Wittrock.

On June 22, Deans found Garland dead at their rented home in London's Belgravia. She was 47 and died from an accidental overdose of barbiturates.

Judy is directed by British director Rupert Goold from a screenplay adaptation of Peter Quilter’s musical play End of the Rainbow by The Crown's Tom Edge.
